DataElement.preferredName: Image Revolution Time 8 Byte Seconds Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Period of time required for a single complete turn of the source around the gantry orbit, expressed as a number of seconds.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._A single complete turn (axial or orbital)._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: A single complete turn (axial or orbital).:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A single complete turn (axial or orbital).
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/22/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes Updated concept definition C41832 to remove special characters for MDR data migration. 3.5.20 Updated definition to remove special characters for MDR data migration. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: FD SEC:Double precision binary floating point number prepresented in IEEE 754:1985 64-bit Floating Point Number Format measured in seconds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.

A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
